availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Congressional Representative and Louisville attorney. Adair County native. Admitted to the bar in 1837. Elected as a Democrat to the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1839. Served as representative of Kentucky's Fourth Congressional District from 1843-1845. Served in Mexican American War with rank of Major and Lieutenant Colonel. Elected to Congress again in 1849 and served until 1851. Practiced law in partnership with Isaac Caldwell.

bibl.p: The History of the Ohio Falls Cities and their Counties, vol. 1 (Cleveland, OH: L. A. Williams & Co., 1882), 494-96. “Death of Hon. George Alfred Caldwell,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), September 18, 1866, p. 1.
